properties.areaDesc: Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 30 at 3:04PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
Light snow accumulations this evening through daybreak on Friday
may result in slick road conditons over northeast New Mexico. A
weak and quick moving disturbance is forecast to bring 1-3 inches
of snow to Raton Pass and areas above 9000 feet in the northern
Sangre de Cristo Mountains. This includes portions of Interstate
25 near the Colorado border, State Highway 38 near Red River and
portions of U.S. Highway 60. Clearing skies are expected by mid-
morning on Friday.

Anyone planning travel in northeast New Mexico tonight should be
prepared to encounter locally adverse weather conditions. Monitor
NOAA weather radio, weather.gov/abq or your local media for the
latest weather updates. For the latest New Mexico road conditions
visit nmroads.com or call 5-1-1.

NWSheadline: SLICK ROAD CONDITIONS POSSIBLE TONIGHT FOR RATON PASS AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE NORTHERN SACRAMENTO MOUNTAINS
